author: Paul Ybarbo
title: Slow down to enjoy Ecuador
text:
Slow down to enjoy Ecuador Paul Ybarb , San Francisco Chronicle By Paul Ybarbo Published 10:00 pm, Thursday, August 27, 2015 Paul Ybarbo, of San Francisco, at the base of Cotopaxi Volcano in the background. Photo: Paul Ybarbo Paul Ybarbo, of San Francisco, at the base of Cotopaxi Volcano in...

Why I went: Wanted to celebrate an “insignificant” birthday in a country with beauty, culture, colonial architecture and hospitable people. There are great opportunities to see wildlife while mountain biking in remote areas. 
Don’t miss: The seafood. Exceptional fish, especially trout ( trucha in Spanish), rich ceviches. Meat is also popular, and if you are curious, you must try the popular guinea pig. 
Don’t bother: Trying to find local wines; Chile and Argentina are better options. Ecuador excels in natural and biodiverse landscapes and has a great locally brewed beer called Pilsner. 
Coolest souvenir: New friends from the tour, great photos, shopping at the Otovalo Market (the largest in South America), a bruised rib from rappelling down gorgeous waterfalls. 
Worth a splurge: Enjoy a wonderful meal at La Petite Mariscal, named for the popular Quito neighborhood. Also, additional day tours to the Mindo Cloud Forest. 
Wish I’d packed: More time. There is so much more to see; the Galapagos Islands must await my next visit. 
Other comments: Allow yourself to slow down; people seem to really enjoy life and meals and spending time together. Within a short distance from the cities, indigenous people can be seen wearing colorful clothing.
